description:
Foolish land-born air breathers! Behold the terror from the depths, the tentacled conqueror of humanity: Squid Girl! With your pollution and stuff you really deserve it, so prepare for menacing, inky doom!

Squid Girl has come from the depths of the sea to conquer humanity for its pollution of the ocean. Within moments of arriving on the surface world, our easily distracted, little invertebrate is promptly bullied into working for the Aizawa sisters as a waitress, supplying their restaurant with squid ink. If poor Squid Girl can't handle two pushy Japanese girls, how will she ever subjugate the human race?

(Source: Media Blasters)
synonyms: The Invader Comes From the Bottom of the Sea!

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

node.description: Rafael Antonio "Tony" Olivier is a Puerto Rican-born American voice actor best known for voicing Rick Hunter from Robotech, Lancer from Fate/stay night, and Arsène Lupin III from Lupin the Third. He helped produce the live action shows Mighty Morphin Power Rangers and VR Troopers.

[Profile (Aoni)](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/ito-kanae.html) | [Profile (Lantis)](https://www.lantis.jp/artist/itokanae/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanae_1126_ito) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/itokanae_info) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ito-kanae/)

After graduating from high school, Kanae enrolled at the Amusement Media Academy, a vocational school for voice actors and artists, and graduated in 2007. Prior to graduating she was a member of two voice acting groups called Koetchi (こえっち) and Rirachitchi (りらちっち) before both groups disbanded in December 2005 and January 28, 2007 respectively.

Her first major role came in 2007 when she played the lead heroine, Amu Hinamori, from the anime Shugo Chara!. The show became a hit and Kanae was praised by critics. Since then, she has voiced Amu in other Shugo Chara! franchises including radio serials, drama CDs and video games.  

She and fellow voice actress Aki Toyosaki are good friends who worked together on several anime including Shugo Chara!, To Love-Ru, The World God Only Knows, Hanasaku Iroha and Toaru Kagaku no Railgun (both also hosted the Toaru Kagaku no Railgun web radio show, Radio no Railgun). 

She was also nominated for "Best Rookie Voice Actress," at the 4th Seiyuu Awards.  

In January 1st, 2024, she announced on both her blog and Twitter account that she got married to a man from outside the entertainment industry.

Non-Anime Roles:

Campanella - The Legend of Heroes Series (VG)
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).
**Michiko Yokote** is a Japanese scriptwriter. She is the pupil of [Kazunori Itou](https://anilist.co/staff/97941).

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

__Height:__ 157 cm (5'2")

[Profile](http://www.pro-baobab.jp/ladies/kanemoto_h/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kanemoto-hisako)

Hisako Kanemoto was raised in Okayama Prefecture and attended Kamogata High School. Upon graduation, she enrolled in the voice acting course at the Vocational School of Art College Kobe. After completing her education in 2008, she moved to Tokyo and joined the training office associated with Production Baobab agency.

Early in her career, Kanemoto used the pseudonym _Juri Aikawa_. She made her anime debut in [Sora no Manimani](https://anilist.co/anime/6098) in 2009 under this name. After landing the lead role in [So Ra No Wo](https://anilist.co/anime/6802) To the following year, Kanemoto announced that she would be using her real name in her works moving forward. She was also cast as the title character in [Shinryaku! Ika Musume](https://anilist.co/anime/8557) later that year.

After a breakthrough 2010, Kanemoto was named Best New Actress at the 5th Seiyuu Awards. She has also voiced a number of mascot characters from Okayama Prefecture because of her origin.

Kanemoto made her debut as a solo musical artist in 2014 under Victor Entertainment with the album Fantastic Voyage.

On May 26, 2018 she announced on her official blog that she will take hiatus from professional activities for studying abroad. Her agency Production BAOBAB confirmed her return to work in March 2019.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Aisia Tsukishiro in "T.P. Sakura ~Time Paladin Sakura~" (VG)
- Akashi Junko in "Blue Archive" (VG)
- Bernabeu in "Hero Must Die" (VG)

He graduated from Yoyogi Animation school and joined Studio Junio afterwards. After leaving Studio Junio, he became a freelancer and often works with Studio Sunrise and GONZO.
In 2008, him and former GONZO producer Ikeda Touyo founded Encourage Films Co., Ltd, with a capital of 5 million yen.
Ikeda Touyo would serve as the representative director and president of Encourage Films. 
With the death of Ikeda Touyo, on February 17, 2013, he was appointed as the representative director and CEO of Encourage Films.

Is a band that perfomed some anime themes.  The opening theme of Shinryaku! Ika Musume  is "Let's Invade!" (侵略ノススメ☆ Shinryaku no Susume☆?) by ULTRA-PRISM with Hisako Kanemoto.  Two songs are used for the opening and ending themes of the anime, "Softenni" (るーるぶっくを忘れちゃえ?) by Ultra-Prism with Shiratama-chū Soft Tennis Club, and "Tsumasakidachi" (つまさきだち?) by Kanae Itō respectively.  The ending theme of Rio: Rainbow Gate!is "Miracle☆Chance" (みらくる☆ちゃんす Mirakuru Chansu?) by ULTRA-PRISM. CD singles of the songs were released on January 26, 2011 by Universal Music.  (Source: Wikipedia)

streamingEpisodes.title: Episode 1 - Who's up for a squid-vasion? / Hold on a squid, aren't you a compatriot? / Aren't I just the squiddiest?
Episode 2 - Wait a squid, aren't you on my side? / Up for a squid-celebration? / Wanna play with this squid?
Episode 3 - Aren't you a fraidy-squid? / You're the squid's sworn enemy, aren't you? / Squidzooks! Aren't you a new recruit?
Episode 4 - How much is that squiddy in the window? / Ride 'em, Squiddy! / You're phonier than an 11-tentacled squid!
Episode 5 - Not from this sea, are you? / Why not join the school of fish? / Wouldn't having a pet be squidtastic?
Episode 6 - Up for an inkredible Hero Stage Show? / Squidn't you be studying right now? / Is this inkfatuation or love?
Episode 7 - Focus your tentacles on her! / Feeling inkuisitive? / A squiddle work never killed anyone.
Episode 8 - Aren't you a squiddle under the weather? / Ink that a new ability? / Squidn't you bring an umbrella?
Episode 9 - Wanna doorbell ditch, squiddo? / Can squids put on make-up? / Holy squid! Is that a secret weapon?
Episode 10 - Isn't that a Teru Teru bosquid? / What squidsn't there to like? / One! Two! Three squids, you're out!
Episode 11 - I ink that's a doll? / Isn't that fishy? / Squids to match my mountains.
Episode 12 - You feeling lucky, squid? / Quite the squidicament we're in. / An even worse squidicament!
